title: Application Configuration Schema

baseUrl.description: The public absolute root URL that the frontend.

host.description: The host that the frontend should be bound to. Only used for local development.

port.description: The port that the frontend should be bound to. Only used for local development.

support.description: Information about support of this Backstage instance and how to contact the integrator team.

items.description: A list of categorized support item groupings.

title.description: The title of the support item grouping.

icon.description: An optional icon for the support item grouping.

links.description: A list of support links for the Backstage instance.

auth.description: Configuration that provides information on available authentication providers configured for app

providers.description: The available auth-provider options and attributes

environment.description:
The 'environment' attribute added as an optional parameter to have configurable environment value for `auth.providers`.
default value: 'development'
optional values: 'development' | 'production'

secret.description: The secret attribute of session object.

baseUrl.description: The public absolute root URL that the backend is reachable at.

listen.description: Address that the backend should listen to.

address.description: Address of the interface that the backend should bind to.

port.description: Port that the backend should listen to.

https.description:
HTTPS configuration for the backend. If omitted the backend will serve HTTP.

Setting this to `true` will cause self-signed certificates to be generated, which
can be useful for local development or other non-production scenarios.

cert.description: PEM encoded certificate. Use $file to load in a file

key.description: PEM encoded certificate key. Use $file to load in a file.

database.description: Database connection configuration, select database type using the `client` field

connection.description: PostgreSQL connection string or knex configuration object.

reading.description:
Configuration related to URL reading, used for example for reading catalog info
files, scaffolder templates, and techdocs content.

allow.description:
A list of targets to allow outgoing requests to. Users will be able to make
requests on behalf of the backend to the targets that are allowed by this list.

host.description:
A host to allow outgoing requests to, being either a full host or
a subdomain wildcard pattern with a leading `*`. For example `example.com`
and `*.example.com` are valid values, `prod.*.example.com` is not.
The host may also contain a port, for example `example.com:8080`.

csp.description:
Content Security Policy options.

The keys are the plain policy ID, e.g. "upgrade-insecure-requests". The
values are on the format that the helmet library expects them, as an
array of strings. There is also the special value false, which means to
remove the default value that Backstage puts in place for that policy.

organization.description: Configuration that provides information about the organization that the app is for.

name.description: The name of the organization that the app belongs to.

integrations.description: Configuration for integrations towards various external repository provider systems

host.description: The hostname of the given Azure instance
The hostname of the given Bitbucket instance

apiBaseUrl.description: The base url for the Bitbucket API, for example https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

appPassword.description: Bitbucket app password used to authenticate requests.

host.description: The hostname of the given GitHub instance

apiBaseUrl.description: The base url for the GitHub API, for example https://api.github.com

rawBaseUrl.description: The base url for GitHub raw resources, for example https://raw.githubusercontent.com

privateKey.description: The private key to use for auth against the app

host.description: The host of the target that this matches on, e.g. "gitlab.com".

apiBaseUrl.description:
The base URL of the API of this provider, e.g.
"https://gitlab.com/api/v4", with no trailing slash.

May be omitted specifically for public GitLab; then it will be deduced.

token.description:
The authorization token to use for requests to this provider.

If no token is specified, anonymous access is used.

baseUrl.description:
The baseUrl of this provider, e.g. "https://gitlab.com", which is
passed into the GitLab client.

If no baseUrl is provided, it will default to https://${host}.

catalog.description: Configuration options for the catalog plugin.

rules.description:
Rules to apply to all catalog entities, from any location.

An undefined list of matchers means match all, an empty list of
matchers means match none.

This is commonly used to put in what amounts to a whitelist of kinds
that regular users of Backstage are permitted to register locations
for. This can be used to stop them from registering yaml files
describing for example a Group entity called "admin" that they make
themselves members of, or similar.

allow.description:
Allow entities of these particular kinds.

E.g. ["Component", "API", "Template", "Location"]

readonly.description:
Readonly defines whether the catalog allows writes after startup.

Setting 'readonly=false' allows users to register their own components.
This is the default value.

Setting 'readonly=true' configures catalog to only allow reads. This can
be used in combination with static locations to only serve operator
provided locations. Effectively this removes the ability to register new
components to a running backstage instance.

locations.description:
A set of static locations that the catalog shall always keep itself
up-to-date with. This is commonly used for large, permanent integrations
that are defined by the Backstage operators at an organization, rather
than individual things that users register dynamically.

These have (optional) rules of their own. These override what the global
rules above specify. This way, you can prevent everybody from register
e.g. User and Group entities, except for one or a few static locations
that have those two kinds explicitly allowed.

For example:

```yaml
rules:
  - allow: [Component, API, Template, Location]
locations:
  - type: url
    target: https://github.com/org/repo/blob/master/users.yaml
    rules:
      - allow: [User, Group]
  - type: url
    target: https://github.com/org/repo/blob/master/systems.yaml
    rules:
      - allow: [System]
```

target.description:
The target URL of the location, e.g.
"https://github.com/org/repo/blob/master/users.yaml".

rules.description:
Optional extra rules that apply to this particular location.

These override the global rules above.

allow.description:
Allow entities of these particular kinds.

E.g. ["Group", "User"]

processors.description: List of processor-specific options and attributes

providers.description: The configuration parameters for each single GitHub org provider.

target.description:
The prefix of the target that this matches on, e.g.
"https://github.com", with no trailing slash.

apiBaseUrl.description:
The base URL of the API of this provider, e.g.
"https://api.github.com", with no trailing slash.

May be omitted specifically for GitHub; then it will be deduced.

token.description:
The authorization token to use for requests to this provider.

If no token is specified, anonymous access is used.

providers.description: The configuration parameters for each single LDAP provider.

target.description:
The prefix of the target that this matches on, e.g.
"ldaps://ds.example.net", with no trailing slash.

bind.description:
The settings to use for the bind command. If none are specified,
the bind command is not issued.

dn.description:
The DN of the user to auth as.

E.g. "uid=ldap-robot,ou=robots,ou=example,dc=example,dc=net"

secret.description: The secret of the user to auth as (its password).

users.description: The settings that govern the reading and interpretation of users.

dn.description:
The DN under which users are stored.

E.g. "ou=people,ou=example,dc=example,dc=net"

options.description:
The search options to use. The default is scope "one" and
attributes "*" and "+".

It is common to want to specify a filter, to narrow down the set
of matching items.

set.description:
JSON paths (on a.b.c form) and hard coded values to set on those
paths.

This can be useful for example if you want to hard code a
namespace or similar on the generated entities.

map.description: Mappings from well known entity fields, to LDAP attribute names

rdn.description:
The name of the attribute that holds the relative
distinguished name of each entry. Defaults to "uid".

name.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.name field of the entity. Defaults to "uid".

description.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.description field of the entity.

displayName.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.displayName field of the entity. Defaults to
"cn".

email.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.email field of the entity. Defaults to
"mail".

picture.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.picture field of the entity.

memberOf.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the values of
the spec.memberOf field of the entity. Defaults to "memberOf".

groups.description: The settings that govern the reading and interpretation of groups.

dn.description:
The DN under which groups are stored.

E.g. "ou=people,ou=example,dc=example,dc=net"

options.description:
The search options to use. The default is scope "one" and
attributes "*" and "+".

It is common to want to specify a filter, to narrow down the set
of matching items.

set.description:
JSON paths (on a.b.c form) and hard coded values to set on those
paths.

This can be useful for example if you want to hard code a
namespace or similar on the generated entities.

map.description: Mappings from well known entity fields, to LDAP attribute names

rdn.description:
The name of the attribute that holds the relative
distinguished name of each entry. Defaults to "cn".

name.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.name field of the entity. Defaults to "cn".

description.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the metadata.description field of the entity. Defaults to
"description".

type.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.type field of the entity. Defaults to "groupType".

displayName.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.displayName field of the entity. Defaults to
"cn".

email.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.email field of the entity.

picture.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the value of
the spec.profile.picture field of the entity.

memberOf.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the values of
the spec.parent field of the entity. Defaults to "memberOf".

members.description:
The name of the attribute that shall be used for the values of
the spec.children field of the entity. Defaults to "member".

roleArn.description: The role to be assumed by this processor

providers.description: The configuration parameters for each single Microsoft Graph provider.

target.description:
The prefix of the target that this matches on, e.g.
"https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0", with no trailing slash.

authority.description:
The auth authority used.

Default value "https://login.microsoftonline.com"

tenantId.description: The tenant whose org data we are interested in.

clientId.description: The OAuth client ID to use for authenticating requests.

clientSecret.description: The OAuth client secret to use for authenticating requests.

userFilter.description:
The filter to apply to extract users.

E.g. "accountEnabled eq true and userType eq 'member'"

groupFilter.description:
The filter to apply to extract groups.

E.g. "securityEnabled eq false and mailEnabled eq true"

clientId.description: Client ID used to Backstage uses to identify when connecting to the Kafka cluster.

brokers.description: List of brokers in the Kafka cluster to connect to.

ssl.description:
Optional SSL connection parameters to connect to the cluster. Passed directly to Node tls.connect.
See https://nodejs.org/dist/latest-v8.x/docs/api/tls.html#tls_tls_createsecurecontext_options

rollbar.description: Configuration options for the rollbar-backend plugin

accountToken.description: The authentication token for accessing the Rollbar API

organization.description: The Rollbar organization name. This can be omitted by using the `rollbar.com/project-slug` annotation.

proxy.description:
A list of forwarding-proxies. Each key is a route to match,
below the prefix that the proxy plugin is mounted on. It must
start with a '/'.

target.description: Target of the proxy. Url string to be parsed with the url module.

headers.description: Object with extra headers to be added to target requests.

changeOrigin.description: Changes the origin of the host header to the target URL. Default: true.

pathRewrite.description:
Rewrite target's url path. Object-keys will be used as RegExp to match paths.
If pathRewrite is not specified, it is set to a single rewrite that removes the entire prefix and route.

allowedMethods.description: Limit the forwarded HTTP methods, for example allowedMethods: ['GET'] to enforce read-only access.

allowedHeaders.description:
Limit the forwarded HTTP methods. By default, only the headers that are considered safe for CORS
and headers that are set by the proxy will be forwarded.

scaffolder.description: Configuration options for the scaffolder plugin

visibility.description: The visibility to set on created repositories.
The visibility to set on created repositories.
The visibility to set on created repositories.

sonarQube.description: Optional configurations for the SonarQube plugin

baseUrl.description: The base url of the sonarqube installation. Defaults to https://sonarcloud.io.

sentry.description: Configuration options for the sentry plugin

techdocs.description: Configuration options for the techdocs-backend plugin

builder.description: Documentation building process depends on the builder attr

awsS3.description: Required when 'type' is set to awsS3

credentials.description:
(Optional) Credentials used to access a storage bucket.
If not set, environment variables or aws config file will be used to authenticate.

roleArn.description: ARN of role to be assumed

region.description:
(Optional) AWS Region.
If not set, AWS_REGION environment variable or aws config file will be used.

endpoint.description:
(Optional) AWS Endpoint.
The endpoint URI to send requests to. The default endpoint is built from the configured region.

openStackSwift.description: Required when 'type' is set to openStackSwift

credentials.description: (Required) Credentials used to access a storage bucket.

authUrl.description: (Required) Auth url sometimes OpenStack uses different port check your OpenStack apis.

keystoneAuthVersion.description:
(Optional) Auth version
If not set, 'v2.0' will be used.

azureBlobStorage.description: Required when 'type' is set to azureBlobStorage

credentials.description: (Required) Credentials used to access a storage container.

accountKey.description:
(Optional) Account secret primary key
If not set, environment variables will be used to authenticate.

googleGcs.description: Required when 'type' is set to googleGcs

credentials.description:
(Optional) API key used to write to a storage bucket.
If not set, environment variables will be used to authenticate.

travisci.description: Configuration options for the travisci plugin

baseUrl.description:
The 'baseUrl' attribute. It should point to the address of the travis portal.
If not provided, frontend plugin will use 'https://travis-ci.com/'

description: This is the schema describing the structure of the app-config.yaml configuration file.
